titles.title: A resolution expressing the sense of the Senate concerning the Iraqi Government's campaign against the Marsh Arabs of southern Iraq.

action.text: Referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations.

calendar.text: Committee on Foreign Relations. Ordered to be reported with an amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Foreign Relations. Reported to Senate by Senator Pell with an amendment and an amended preamble. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 304.

vote.text: Resolution agreed to in Senate with amendments and an amended preamble by Voice Vote. (consideration: CR 11/19/93 S16594-16595)

bill.summary: 11/20/1993--Passed Senate amended. Declares that the Federal Government should immediately: (1) raise in the United Nations Security Council the issue of Saddam Hussein's campaign of repression against the marsh Arabs; (2) insist that United Nations weapons inspectors be permitted to conduct on site inspections concerning the possible use by Iraqi troops of chemical weapons; (3) seek to provide humanitarian assistance to persons fleeing from the marshes; and (4) study and report to the Congress concerning the environmental consequences of the destruction of this vast wetlands area.
